journey.title: Journeys
journey.previewHelp: Copy and paste into an incognito window to preview journey.
journey.usageHelp: Use when configuring the ForgeRock SDK or calling the REST APIs.
journey.description: Sign in users to your application using any of the out-of-the-box journeys or customize them to suit your specific requirements.
journey.noJourneySubtitle: Configure journeys to allow users to sign in, register and perform self-service functions like reset their password or recover their username.
journey.noAuthServicesMessage: Sign in users to your application by creating journeys

editModal.treeNameDescription: Human-friendly name for this user flow.
editModal.treeManagedIdentityDescription: Managed identity to authenticate using this journey.
editModal.treeDescriptionDescription: Provide consumers of your flow a brief description of this flow.

deleteModal.title: Delete Journey?
deleteModal.content: Are you sure you want to delete this journey?

bulkImport.title: Import Identities
bulkImport.description: Bulk import identity data from cvs files.
bulkImport.formatCsv: Format your CSV file (max %{maxImportSize}MB) according to this
bulkImport.matchUsingHelp: Select one or more properties for unique record match.
bulkImport.cancelImportDescription: Are you sure you want to cancel your import? If you cancel, pending records will not be processed.
bulkImport.selectIdentity: Select the managed identity object into which you want to import your CSV identities.
bulkImport.deleteImportConfirmation: If you delete this import the entries imported will remain, but import record will be deleted from the list.

createApplication.title: Add a New Application
createApplication.description: Add your application to the platform, and integrate the app with ForgeRock authentication.

connectIdentities.title: Connect Identities
connectIdentities.description: Create and manage identity profiles across applications and IT infrastructure.

managedAccess.title: Manage Access
managedAccess.description: Manage how your users can authenticate and gain access to your systems.

managedIdentities.title: Manage Identities
managedIdentities.description: Control where, when, and how your users can change their information.

welcome.title: ForgeRock Identity Platform
welcome.description: Helps your customers, workforce, and IoT identities access the connected world – safely and simply.

remoteServers.confirmDeleteRemoteServer: Are you sure you want to delete the "{name}" remote server?
remoteServers.errorServerExists: Server name is already in use, please specify a different name
remoteServers.noRemoteServersSubtitle: Connect to identities that live on remote servers.
remoteServers.keyDescription: Authentication password shared between the remote server and Identity Cloud.
remoteServers.displayNameDescription: Identifier to be displayed in the Remote Server list.
remoteServers.clientModeDescription:
By default, Identity Cloud initiates connections using the remote server port.
In client mode, the remote connector server initiates connections to Identity Cloud using HTTP or HTTPS.
remoteServers.proxyHostDescription: Fully-qualified proxy server name. Example: http://myserver.forgerock.com
remoteServers.proxyUserDescription: Administrator or username authorized to access the proxy host.
remoteServers.houseKeepingIntervalPassword: Number of seconds between server housekeepings.
remoteServers.pingPongIntervalPassword: Number of seconds between messages sent to keep websockets open.
remoteServers.connectionGroupCheckIntervalPassword: Number of seconds between pings to a connection group.
remoteServers.webSocketConnectionsPassword: Number of sockets to hold open.
remoteServers.subtitle: Enable data sync from remote on-prem servers. Cluster remote servers together to enable scaling and fallback.
remoteServers.title: Connect Servers

newServerModal.serverDescription: ForgeRock initiates the connection to the remote server. Use this option if the remote server is not behind a firewall, or if ForgeRock is allowed direct access to the remote server through the firewall.
newServerModal.clientDescription: ForgeRock waits for the remote server to initiate the connection. Use this option if the remote server is behind a firewall, and if the firewall prevents ForgeRock from directly accessing the remote server.
newServerModal.newRemoteServerDescription: Connecting to an identity resource involves deploying and running a piece of software on your side.
newServerModal.selectConnectionInitiation: Choose how the connection to the remote server should be initiated.
newServerModal.getStartedRegisterRemoteServer: To get started, register your remote server by providing a name and connection settings.
newServerModal.registerRemoteServer: Register your remote server by providing a name and connection settings.
newServerModal.downloadRemote: Download a remote server based on your needs.
newServerModal.stepByStep: Follow the instructions to install & configure a remote server.
newServerModal.secureConnect: to securely connect your remote server.

deleteModal.title: Delete Server?
deleteModal.content: Are you sure you want to delete this server?

serverClusters.title: Server Clusters
serverClusters.chooseClusterType: Choose whether you are clustering connector servers operating as servers or clients.
serverClusters.chooseLikeServers: Choose only servers that have the same connectors installed.
serverClusters.noServerClustersSubtitle: Cluster connector servers to activate scaling and fallback across resources.
serverClusters.nameDescription: The name to display in the Server Clusters list.
serverClusters.confirmDeleteServerCluster: Are you sure you want to delete this server cluster?
serverClusters.confirmDeleteServer: Are you sure you want to remove this server?
serverClusters.addServersToCluster: Add Servers to an Existing Cluster
serverClusters.selectServers: Select any connected server to add it to the cluster.
serverClusters.errorClusterExists: Server Cluster name is already in use, please specify a different name
serverClusters.uniqueError: Name must be unique to be used as a '-' separated ID (Display Name becomes display-name)
serverClusters.algorithmDescription: Failover ensures that if the primary server fails, service falls back to a designated server. Round robin continuously balances the load among two or more servers.

trees.failedToGetNodeType: Failed to gather node type details
trees.failedToUpdateNodeOutcomes: Failed to update node type outcomes

identities.subTitle: Create and configure ForgeRock-hosted identity resources.

listView.title: Applications
listView.subTitle: Set up your applications to use ForgeRock authentication.
listView.name: Name

addAppModal.enterpriseHelpText: Set up SSO to an application like Google, Salesforce, or Office365
addAppModal.consumerHelpText: Integrate authentication with your web, native, or service app
addAppModal.createCredentials: Create a client ID for your application.
addAppModal.createCredentialsWithSecret: Create a client ID and secret for your application.
addAppModal.alphaNumericDashOnly: Can only contain alphanumeric characters, numbers, dashes or underscores
addAppModal.noSpace: Cannot start or end with the space character
addAppModal.clientSecretWarning: Make sure you copy <small class="text-monospace alert-link">Client Secret</small> as it won't be shown again.

listApps.noDataTitle: You haven't added any applications yet
listApps.noDataSubtitle: Set up an application to use ForgeRock authentication.

accessTab.title: Access
accessTab.responseTypesHelp: Response types this client will support and use.
accessTab.claimsHelp: List of claim name translations, which will override those specified for the authorization server. Claims are values that are presented to the user to inform them what data is being made available to the Client.
accessTab.loopbackInterfaceRedirectionLabel: Allow wildcard ports in redirect URLs
accessTab.loopbackInterfaceRedirectionHelp: This flag indicates whether wildcards can be used for port numbers in redirect URIs. For example - https://127.0.0.1:{port}/{path} for IPv4 and https://[::1]:{port}/{path} for IPv6.

authenticationTab.title: Authentication
authenticationTab.tokenEndpointAuthMethodHelp: The authentication method with which a client authenticates to the authorization server at the token endpoint. The authentication method applies to OIDC requests with the openid scope.
authenticationTab.clientTypeHelp: Type of OAuth 2.0 client. Confidential clients can keep their password secret, and are typically web apps or other server-based clients. Public clients run the risk of exposing their password to a host or user agent, such as rich browser applications or desktop clients.
authenticationTab.isConsentImpliedHelp: When active, the resource owner will not be asked for consent during authorization flows. The OAuth2 Provider must be configured to allow clients to skip consent.
authenticationTab.mixUpMitigationHelp: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation on the authorization server side. Enable this setting only if this OAuth 2.0 client supports the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise AM will fail to validate access token requests received from this client.
authenticationTab.defaultAcrValuesHelp: Default requested Authentication Context Class Reference values.
authenticationTab.requestUrisHelp: Array of request_uri values that are pre-registered by the RP for use at the OP.
authenticationTab.subjectTypeHelp: The subject type added to responses for this client.
authenticationTab.defaultMaxAgeEnabledHelp: Whether or not the default max age is enforced.
authenticationTab.mTLSTrustedCertHelp: Self-signed PEM-encoded X.509 certificate for mTLS client certificate authentication.
authenticationTab.mTLSSubjectDNHelp: Expected Subject DN of certificate used for mTLS client certificate authentication. Defaults to CN=client_id. Only applicable when using CA-signed certificates.

clientManagementTab.title: Client Management
clientManagementTab.updateAccessTokenHelp: The access token used to update the client.

consentScreenTab.title: Consent Screen
consentScreenTab.nameHelp: A client name that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.
consentScreenTab.descriptionsHelp: A description of the client or other information that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.
consentScreenTab.policyUriHelp: The URI for the client's privacy policy, for use in user-facing consent pages.

endpointResponseFormatsTab.title: Endpoint Response Formats
endpointResponseFormatsTab.userinfoResponseFormatHelp: The user info endpoint offers different output format. See http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse
endpointResponseFormatsTab.tokenIntrospectionResponseFormatHelp: The token introspection endpoint offers different output format. see https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-jwt-introspection-response-03

sessionManagementTab.title: Session Management
sessionManagementTab.clientSessionUriHelp: This is the URI that will be used to check messages sent to the session management endpoints. This URI must match the origin of the message.

signingAndEncryptionTab.title: Signing and Encryption
signingAndEncryptionTab.publicKeyLocationHelp: Select the public key for this client to come from either the jwks_uri, manual jwks or X509 field.
signingAndEncryptionTab.jwksUriHelp: The uri that contains the client's public keys in Json Web Key format.
signingAndEncryptionTab.jwkSetHelp: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the client's public keys.
signingAndEncryptionTab.idTokenPublicEncryptionKeyLabel: Client ID Token Public Encryption Key
signingAndEncryptionTab.idTokenPublicEncryptionKeyHelp: A Base64 encoded public key for encrypting ID Tokens.

generalSettings.redirectionUrisHelp: Whitelist for sign-in redirect URLs. eg. http://www.example.com/signin
generalSettings.postLogoutRedirectUriHelp: Whitelist for sign-out redirect URLs. eg. http://www.example.com/signout
generalSettings.grantTypesHelp: Authorization Code is required for SPA/Native apps.
generalSettings.scopesHelp: Scopes are strings that are presented to the user for approval and included in tokens so that the protected resource may make decisions about what to give access to.
generalSettings.logoUriHelp: Application logo URI for use in user-facing UIs such as consent pages and application pages.

deleteAppModal.modalText: Are you sure you want to delete {appName}?

realm.title: Realm
realm.dnsAliasesDescription: List of fully-qualified DNS aliases for the realm.
realm.useClientBasedSessionsDescription: Client-based sessions provide elastic scalability by storing all session state as a JWT in a cookie stored on the client. It is highly recommended to enable signing and encryption of the JWT in the global session service.
realm.typeToAddDnsAlias: Type and press enter to add a DNS alias
realm.deactivateModalText: If you deactivate this realm users will be prevented from signing in. Are you sure you want to deactivate this realm?
realm.activeRealmMessage: This is an active realm. All configuration data will be lost if deleted. You can set the realm as inactive to prevent login but retain configuration data.
realm.deleteModalText2: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this realm?

logApiKeys.noLogApiKeysText: You haven't added any log API keys
logApiKeys.logApiKeyDescription: Send log data to third party services like Splunk or LogStash.
logApiKeys.getApiKeyDataFail: Unable to retrieve API key data

deleteApiKeyModal.modalText: Are you sure you want to delete this log API key?

createApiKeyModal.oneTimeSecretStatement: Make sure you copy api_key_secret below as it won't be shown again.

inviteAdmin.partialSuccessMessage: You’ve invited {totalCount} admin(s), but {failCount} invitation(s) didn't send. Review the below errors.
inviteAdmin.noSuccessMessage: {count} invitation(s) didn't send. Review the errors below.
inviteAdmin.notice: IMPORTANT: Each invited admin will receive an email to setup their admin account and have the permission to fully administer this organization.
inviteAdmin.errorAdminOnboarding: There was an issue onboarding admin
inviteAdmin.errorUnique: This person already exists in your tenant.
